Welcome to mcc’s documentation!¶

Contents:

mcclib.classDataset.load(arrays, path, fileprefix, dt, readOnly=True)¶

Loads a dataset with the specified array configuration from path, using a certain fileprefix.

mcclib.classMaze.arrayIndexFromPos(pos, density)¶

Returns the array index corresponding to pos as a tuple. pos should be a numpy array.

class mcclib.classMesenchymal.Mesenchymal¶

Represents an agent that can use his energy to degrade walls..

mcclib.statutils.avgEnergyForAgent(energies, states)¶

Returns the average energy over time for a single agent. The only states that are taken into account are MOVING and ORIENTING.

mcclib.statutils.avg_vel(velocities)¶

Returns velocity averaged over agents AND time

mcclib.statutils.clearStatistics(folder)¶

Remove some files created by statistics.py in a given folder.

mcclib.statutils.dicAsText(dic)¶

Take a given Python dictionary and return it as a string.

mcclib.statutils.doCombinations(stats, varname, data, amoeboids, mesenchymals, successful, function=<function mean at 0x28cf1b8>, axis=None)¶

Apply a given function to all elements of a given array, and do so for all desired combinations. The combinations are for example “all agents that are amoeboid and were successful. Note that some of these results may make little sense because too few agents fit the criteria.

mcclib.statutils.finalstats(ds, goal, success_radius)¶

Calculate some of the statistics that we’re interested in at the end of a simulation.

mcclib.statutils.getDistances(positions, goal)¶

Return an array containing the distances of all agents from the goal.

mcclib.statutils.getSuccessrates(dist, success_radius)¶

Returns success rates averaged over agents (axis=1) but not averaged over time.

mcclib.statutils.savefinalstats(picklepath, textpath, const, dataset)¶

Calculate the finalstats and save them once as a pickle file and once as a text file.

mcclib.utils.applyFilter(constlist, name, valuelist)¶

Given a list of const variables, return another list containing only the ones fulfilling a given criteria, namely the parameter name has to have one of the values in valuelist.

mcclib.utils.copyAnimScript(destination)¶

For ease of use copy shell script that creates video right into the results folder.

mcclib.utils.debug(*args, **kwargs)¶

Log a string or several at DEBUG level.

mcclib.utils.ensure_dir(f)¶

Make sure that the directory f exists by creating it if necessary.

mcclib.utils.error(*args, **kwargs)¶

Log a string or several at ERROR level.

mcclib.utils.exec_silent_command(command)¶

Execute a given command, suppressing all output.

mcclib.utils.getDirTimestamp(directory)¶

Get the timestamp of a given simulation.

mcclib.utils.getFolders(searchpath, pattern)¶

Get a list of all the folders matching pattern.

mcclib.utils.getGradient(a)¶

Return the gradient as given by the NumPy gradient function.

mcclib.utils.getOriginalGradient(mazefilename, maze=None)¶

At the beginning of the simulation, read the gradient for a maze from a file (or, if the file doesn’t exist, create it and save the gradient in it).

mcclib.utils.getResultsDir(filename)¶

From a given simfile, create a name for a folder in results that is obtained by removing the file ending.

mcclib.utils.getResultsFilepath(*pathelements)¶

Given one or several folders and possibly a filename return the complete path.

mcclib.utils.getSimfiles(simdir)¶

Get all valid simfiles in simdir.

mcclib.utils.info(*args, **kwargs)¶

Log a string or several at INFO level.

mcclib.utils.loadImage(path)¶

Load an image (for a maze) from a given path and do some transformations on it.

mcclib.utils.makeFolderEmpty(folder)¶

Remove all the files in a folder.

mcclib.utils.natsort(list_, separator='_', lastisint=False)¶

Function not used as of now.

mcclib.utils.norm(v)¶

Calculate the Euclidean norm of a two-dimensional vector.

mcclib.utils.normsq(v)¶

Calculate the squared norm.

mcclib.utils.readConst(directory, simfile)¶

Return the parameter settings containted in the variable const in a file in the folder sim/.

mcclib.utils.removeFilesByEnding(path, ending)¶

Delete all files in a folder that have a given ending.

mcclib.utils.savetimestamp(folder)¶

Save the timestamp for a given results folder.

mcclib.utils.scaleToMax(newmax, arr)¶

Make sure the maximum value of all the pixel in an array is newmax.

mcclib.utils.unravel(const)¶

Unravels a given const file along a certain axis, creating as many const variables as can be obtained by the parameter settings in the file.

mcclib.utils.unravel_fixedaxis(const, axis, exclude=None)¶

Unravels a given const file along a certain axis. Returns a list of lists: - the outer list containing a tuple consisting of the inner list and an appropriate name (for files, folders) - the inner list containing the const dictionaries arranged as given by “axis”.

mcclib.utils.validSimfile(filename)¶

Check that a given file is a valid simfile. Ignore if it starts with _ or is in the ignore list.

mcclib.utils.verifySimulationNecessary(constfilename, resultsfolder)¶

Run the simulation if there are no results corresponding to the sim file or if the sim file is newer than the results.
